<br>
I am Yujia Li, currently a Ph.D Candidate in Biostatisitics at the School of Public Health, University of Pittsburgh under supervision of [Dr. George C. Tseng](http://www.pitt.edu/~ctseng/). My research focuses on developing novel statistical methods in statistical machine learning, Bayesian analysis, high-dimensional variable selection, Analysis of Multi-Omics Data (Genomics, Transcriptomics, Epigenetics, etc)

In addition to methodological research, I am involved in collaborative data analysis under guidance of [Steffi Oesterreich](https://www.pharmacology.us/Faculty/SteffiOesterreich?AspxAutoDetectCookieSupport=1), [Hung Jung Park](https://publichealth.pitt.edu/home/directory/hyun-jung-park) and [Liza Konnikova](https://medicine.yale.edu/profile/liza_konnikova/), with application to breast cancer and pediatrics metabolomics.

I received my Bachelor of Science degree of Applied Mathematics (under supervision of [Da Zhou](http://math-faculty.xmu.edu.cn/display.aspx?tid=116&AspxAutoDetectCookieSupport=1)) and a minor certificate of Mathematical Finance at Xiamen University. 


<br>
I did internship at Abbvie as a Biostatistician from May to August 2020, under supervision of Yunxia Sui, Tian Feng and Yiran (Bonnie) Hu.
